member.summary: Specifies NI-DCPower automatically selects an aperture time used for autoranging.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerMeasurementAutorangeApertureTimeMode.Custom
member.summary: Specifies NI-DCPower uses the value specified by the autorange aperture minimum time property.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerMeasurementAutorangeBehavior.RangeUpToLimitThenDown
member.summary: Specifies the hardware go to limit range then range down as needed until measured value is within thresholds.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerMeasurementAutorangeBehavior.RangeUp
member.summary: Specifies the hardware go up one range when the upper threshold is reached.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerMeasurementAutorangeBehavior.RangeUpAndDown
member.summary: Specifies the hardware go up or down one range when the upper/lower threshold is reached.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerAdvanced.PowerSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the power source to use. NI-DCPower switches the power source used by the device to the specified value.
member.value: The default value is .

remarks.note: Automatic selection is not persistent and occurs only at the time this property is set to . However, if the session is in the Committed or Uncommitted state when you set this property, the power source selection occurs only after you call the method.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerAdvanced.PowerSourceInUse
member.summary: Gets whether the device is using the internal or auxiliary power source to generate power.
member.value: Returns an object of type .

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerAdvanced.AuxiliaryPowerSourceAvailable
member.summary: Gets whether an auxiliary power source is connected to the device.
member.value: A value of false indicates that the auxiliary input fuse has blown.
member.remarks: For more information about internal and auxiliary power, refer to the Detecting Internal/Auxiliary Power topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help. This property does not necessarily indicate whether the device is using the auxiliary power source to generate power. Use the property to retrieve this information.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerAdvancedSequenceProperty.Autorange
member.summary: Specifies whether the hardware automatically selects the best range to measure the signal. Note the highest range the algorithm uses is dependent on the corresponding limit range property. The algorithm the hardware uses can be controlled using the Autorange mode property.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerControl
member.summary: Provides methods to control the programming state of NI-DCPower.
member.remarks: For more information, refer to NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerControl.Commit
member.summary: Applies the settings that you configured previously to the device. Calling this method moves the NI-DCPower session from the Uncommitted state into the Committed state. If you modify any property after you call this method, the NI-DCPower session reverts to the Uncommitted state. Use the method to transition to the Running state.
member.remarks: Refer to the Programming States topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for information about the specific NI-DCPower software states.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerControl.Initiate
member.summary: Starts generation or acquisition, causing the NI-DCPower session to leave the Uncommitted state or Committed state and enter the Running state. To return to the Uncommitted state call the method.
member.remarks: For more information about the specific NI-DCPower software states, refer to the Programming States topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerControl.Abort
member.summary: Transitions the NI-DCPower session from the Running state to the Uncommitted state. If a sequence is running, then the NI-DCPower session is stopped. Any configuration methods called after this method are not applied until the method is called. If power output is enabled when you call the method, the output channels remain in their current state and continue providing power. Use the property to disable power output on a per channel basis. Use the method to disable output on all channels.
member.remarks: For information about the specific NI-DCPower software states, refer to the Programming States topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerDriverOperation.Dispose
member.summary: Closes the specified session and deallocates the reserved resources, if not already disposed.
member.remarks:
You can call this method safely more than once, even if the session is already closed.
A call to this method disposes the SafeHandle class used to hold the instrument handle. If the call to this method fails due to some reason, like the session being closed by some external means, you will not be notified about the failure. To help you identify failures in the ReleaseHandle method of the SafeHandle class, managed debugging assistant (MDA) is activated.
For details refer to .
The call to this method fails when you externally close a session by:
Initializing a session with a resource name for which the session is already open, within the same process. This causes the instrument handle held by the existing session to become invalid.
Getting the instrument handle out using the method and closing this handle directly.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerDriverUtility.ResetDevice
member.summary: Performs a hard reset on the device.
member.remarks: Resets the device to a known state. The method disables power generation, resets session properties to their default values, properties clears errors such as over temperature and unexpected loss of auxiliary power, commits the session properties, and leaves the session in the Uncommitted state. This method also performs a hard reset on the device and driver software. This method has the same functionality as using reset in Measurement and Automation Explorer. This will also open the output relay on devices that have an output relay.
member.exception:
The method was called after the associated
object was disposed.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerDriverUtility.ImportAttributeConfigurationFile(System.String)
member.summary: Imports a configuration to the session from the specified file.
member.remarks:
You can export and import session attribute configurations only between NI-DCPower devices with identical model numbers and the same number of configured channels. You cannot call this method while the session is in the Running state.
Supported Configurations You can export and import the following between NI-DCPower sessions:
Attribute configurations
Advanced sequences
Support for this Method You must set the session source mode to Sequence in order to configure or export and import advanced sequences. Exporting and importing simple sequences between sessions in Sequence source mode is unsupported.
Channel Mapping Behavior When importing and exporting configurations between NI-DCPower sessions that were initialized with different channels, the configurations of the exporting channels are mapped to the importing channels in the order you specify in the channelString input to the constructor. For example, if your entry for channelString is "0,1" for the exporting session and "1,2" for the importing session:
The configuration exported from channel 0 is imported into channel 1.
The configuration exported from channel 1 is imported into channel 2.
NI-DCPower will return an exception if the total number of channels initialized for the exporting session is not equal to the total number of channels initialized for the importing session.
member.param: The absolute path to the file that contains the configuration to import. If you specify an empty or relative path, this method returns an exception. The default file extension is .nidcpowerconfig.
member.exception:
The method was called after the associated
object was disposed.
The underlying NI-DCPower driver returned an error.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerMeasureCompleteEvent.WaitForEvent(NationalInstruments.PrecisionTimeSpan)
member.summary: Waits until the device has generated the specified event. The session monitors whether each type of event has occurred at least once since the last time this method or the method was called. If an event has only been generated once, and you call this method successively, the method times out. Individual events must be generated between separate calls of this method.
member.param: Specifies the maximum time allowed for this function to complete, in seconds. If the function does not complete within this time interval, NI-DCPower returns an error.

remarks.note: This method must only be called in the Running state. For more information about the specific NI-DCPower software states, refer to the Programming States topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerMeasurement.Measure(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a struct that contains arrays of measured voltage and current.
member.remarks: Each call to this method blocks other method calls until the measurements are returned from the device. The order of the measurements returned in the array corresponds to the order on the specified output channel(s). The measurement speed of the device and the property dictates the length of time that a measurement takes.
member.param: Specifies the output channels to measure. You can specify multiple channels by using a channel list or a channel range. A channel list is a comma (,) separated sequence of channel names (e.g. 0,2 specifies channels 0 and 2). A channel range is a lower bound channel followed by a hyphen (-) or colon (:) followed by an upper bound channel (e.g. 0-2 specifies channels 0, 1, and 2). Use empty string to specify all channels in the session.
member.returns:
Returns a struct that contains arrays of current measurements and voltage measurements.
The measurements in the arrays are returned in the same order as the channels specified in the channel string on which the measurement is done.
member.exception:
The method was accessed after the associated
object was disposed.

Use empty string to specify all channels in the session.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerMeasurement.QueryInCompliance(System.String)
member.summary: Queries the device to indicate if the output is operating at the compliance limit.

item.description: The compliance limit is the current limit when the output method is set to . If the output is operating at the compliance limit, the output reaches the current limit before the desired voltage level.
The compliance limit is the voltage limit when the output method is set to . If the output is operating at the compliance limit, the output reaches the voltage limit before the desired current level.

member.param: Specifies the output channel to query. Compliance status can only be queried for one channel at a time.
member.returns: Returns whether the device output channel is in compliance.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerOutputMeasurement.BufferSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of samples that the active channel measurement buffer can hold.
member.value:
The default value is the maximum number of samples that a device is capable of recording in one second.
Valid values range from 1000 to 2147483647.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerOutputMeasurement.NoiseRejection
member.summary: Gets or sets the relative weighting of samples in a measurement.
member.value: The default value is .
member.remarks: For more information about noise rejection, refer to the NI PXIe-4140/4141 DC Noise Rejection topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help. This property is supported only on the NI PXIe-4140/4141.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerOutputMeasurement.SamplesToAverage
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of samples to average when you take a measurement. Increasing the number of samples to average decreases measurement noise, but increases the time required to take a measurement.
member.remarks: Refer to the NI PXI-4110 Measurement Averaging , NI PXI-4130 Measurement Averaging, NI PXI-4132 Sample Averaging, or NI PXIe-4154 Measurement Averaging topics in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for optional property settings to improve immunity to certain noise types, or refer to the NI PXIe-4140/4141 DC Noise Rejection topic for information about improving noise immunity for those devices.

value.para:
The default values for the following devices are:
NI PXI-4110/NI PXI-4130 - 10
NI PXI-4132 - 1
NI PXIe-4140/4141 - 1
NI PXIe-4154 - 500

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerOutputSource.SetSequence(System.Double[])
member.summary: Configures a series of voltage or current outputs and corresponding source delays. The source mode must be set to for this method to take effect.
member.remarks:
Refer to the Configuring the Source Unit topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for more information about how to configure your device.
Use this method in the Uncommitted or Committed programming states. Refer to the Programming States topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for more information about NI-DCPower programming states.
This method is not supported on all devices. Refer to the Supported Functions by Device topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for more information about supported devices.
member.param:
Specifies the series of voltage levels or current levels, depending on the configured output method.
The valid values for this parameter are defined by the voltage level range or current level range.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerOutputSource.SetSequence(System.Double[],NationalInstruments.PrecisionTimeSpan[])
member.summary: Configures a series of voltage or current outputs and corresponding source delays.
member.remarks:
The source mode must be set to for this method to take effect.
Refer to the Configuring the Source Unit topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for more information about how to configure your device.
Use this method in the Uncommitted or Committed programming states. Refer to the Programming States topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for information about the specific NI-DCPower software states.
This method is not supported on all devices. Refer to the Supported Functions by Device topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for more information about supported devices.
member.param:
Specifies the series of voltage levels or current levels, depending on the configured output method.
The valid values for this parameter are defined by the voltage level range or current level range.

Specifies the source delay, in seconds, that follows the configuration of each value in the sequence.
The valid values must be in the range of [0,167].

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerOutputSource.OvpLimit
member.summary: Determines the voltage limit, in volts, beyond which overvoltage protection (OVP) engages. Limit is specified as a positive value, but symmetric positive and negative limits are enforced simultaneously. For example, setting the OVP Limit to 65 will configure the OVP feature to trigger an OVP error if the output exceeds ±65 V.
member.value: Valid values vary by device. Refer to the Supported Properties by Device topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for the default value by device.
member.remarks: Refer to the Output Overvoltage Protection topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for more information about overvoltage protection. Refer to the Supported Properties by Device topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for information about supported devices.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerOutputSource.SequenceStepDeltaTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time, in seconds, between the start of two consecutive steps in a sequence.
member.value:
The default value is 50 ms.
Valid Values:
Device Values
PXIe-4135
PXIe-4136/4137
PXIe-4138/4139 [12.5 μs, 60 s]
PXIe-4140/4141
PXIe-4142/4143
PXIe-4144/4145 [10 μs, 60 s]
NI-DCPower coerces the value you specify for this property to the nearest multiple of a device-specific resolution. You can read back the value of this property to determine the coerced value.
Device Selected Value Resolution
PXIe-4135
PXIe-4136/4137
PXIe-4138/4139 [12.5 μs, 21.4748 s] 10 ns
(21.4748 s, 60 s] 10 μs
PXIe-4140/4141
PXIe-4142/4143
PXIe-4144/4145 [10 μs, 233.0169 ms] 27.7778 ns
(233.0169 ms, 60 s] 10 μs

remarks.para: You can specify as one of the properties when calling the method. In this case, this property specifies the amount of time between the start of the active step and the start of the next step.

This property is applicable only if the property is set to . Refer to the property for more information about the settings with which this property is compatible. This property does not apply to the last step of the last iteration of a sequence.

You can set values for the and Measurement properties in conjunction with this property. Values for may conflict with the value of this property; Measurement properties may conflict with the value of this property only if the property is set to .
remarks.note: This property is not supported by all devices. Refer to the Supported Properties by Device topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for information about supported devices.
Refer to the Sequence Step Delta Time topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for more information.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerOutputSource.RequestedPowerAllocation
member.summary: Gets or sets the power, in watts, to request the device to source from each active channel.
member.value:
Returns a double value that is the amount of power, in watts, requested to be allocated for the channel.
The default value is 0.
Valid values are [0, device per-channel maximum power].

remarks.para: This property defines the power to source from the device only if the property is set to .
The power you request with this property may be incompatible with the power a given source configuration requires or the power the device can provide:

item.description: Requested power < power required for source configuration
Device does not exceed the requested power
Requested power > maximum per-channel or overall sourcing power
Device does not exceed the allowed power

remarks.note: This property is not supported by all devices. Refer to the Supported Properties by Device topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for information about supported devices.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerOutputSource.ActualPowerAllocation
member.summary: Gets the power, in watts, the device is sourcing on each active channel if the property is set to or .
member.value:
Returns a double value that is the amount of power, in watts, allocated for the channel. Returns -1 when the property is set to .
The default value is 0.
Valid values are [0, device per-channel maximum power].

remarks.note: This property is not supported by all devices. Refer to the Supported Properties by Device topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for information about supported devices.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerOutputSource.PowerAllocationMode
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the device sources the power its output configuration requires or a specific wattage you request; gets or sets whether NI-DCPower proactively checks that this sourcing power is within the maximum per-channel and overall sourcing power of the device.

item.description: The default value is for the PXIe-4147.
The default value is for other devices.

remarks.para: When this property configures NI-DCPower to perform a sourcing power check, a device is not permitted to source power in excess of its maximum per-channel or overall sourcing power. If the check determines an output configuration or power request would require the device to do so, NI-DCPower returns an error.

When this property does not configure NI-DCPower to perform a sourcing power check, a device complies with requests to source power in excess of its maximum per-channel or overall sourcing power and may shut down to prevent damage.
remarks.note: This property is not supported by all devices. Refer to the Supported Properties by Device topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for information about supported devices. Devices that do not support this property behave as if this property were set to .

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerOutputSourceAdvancedSequencing.CreateAdvancedSequence(System.String,NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerAdvancedSequenceProperty[],System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Creates an empty advanced sequence. Call the method to add steps to the active advanced sequence, or the method to add a Commit step.
You must set the to to use this method. Refer to for more information about supported properties. This method is not supported on all devices. Refer to the Supported Functions by Device topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for more information about supported devices.
Using the method with Advanced Sequence methods is unsupported.
Use this method in the Uncommitted or Committed programming states. Refer to the Programming States topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for more information about NI-DCPower programming states.
member.param: Specifies the name of the sequence to create.
Specifies the properties you reconfigure per step in the advanced sequence.
Specifies that the current sequence is active.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerOutputSourceAdvancedSequencing.CreateAdvancedSequenceStep(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Creates a new advanced sequence step in the active advanced sequence, specified by the property. You can configure properties for the new step only after the step is created.
When you create an advanced sequence step, each property you passed to is reset to its default value for the new step. To configure the step, you must first designate the new step as the active step using the property or the parameter of this method. Once the step is active, you can configure the properties for the step.
You must set the to to use this method. Refer to for more information about supported properties. This method is not supported on all devices. Refer to the Supported Functions by Device topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for more information about supported devices. Using the method with Advanced Sequence methods is unsupported.
member.param: Specifies that this current step in the active sequence is active.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerOutputSourceAdvancedSequencing.CreateAdvancedSequenceCommitStep(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Creates a Commit step in the active advanced sequence. A Commit step configures the device to a user-defined known state before starting the advanced sequence.
When you create an advanced sequence step or Commit step, each property you passed to is reset to its default value for the new step. To configure the Commit step, you must first designate the Commit step as the active step by setting the property to -1 or the parameter of this method to . Once the step is active, you can configure the properties for the step.
You must set the to to use this method. Refer to for more information about supported properties. This method is not supported on all devices. Refer to the Supported Functions by Device topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for more information about supported devices. Using the method with Advanced Sequence methods is unsupported.
When a Commit step exists in the active advanced sequence, you cannot set to or in either the Commit step (-1) or step 0.
When Does the Commit Step Run in a Sequence?
The driver applies the Commit step to the device when the session transitions to the Committed state. After the driver applies the Commit step to the device, the driver waits until the Source Delay has elpased before waiting for the Start trigger.
You can provide a specific for the Commit step if you set as one of the properties to be configured with .
If you call while the device is in the Uncommitted state, the session implicitly moves through the Commited state before moving to the Running state.
Differences Between the Commit Step and Other Steps
The source unit does not wait on any triggers before running the Commit step.
The source unit does not emit a Source Complete Event when the Commit step is complete.
No measurements are taken in the Commit step, therefore you cannot set the , , or properties in the Commit step.
The property does not apply to the Commit step, and you cannot configure the SequenceStepDeltaTime property in the Commit step.
member.param: Specifies that this current step in the active sequence is active.
member.exception: The method was called after the associated object was disposed.
The method was called in a session to unsupported hardware.
The method was called with an unknown channel.
The underlying NI-DCPower driver returned an error.

Deletes a previously created advanced sequence and all the advanced sequence steps in the advanced sequence.
You must set the to to use this method. Refer to for more information about supported properties. This method is not supported on all devices. Refer to the Supported Functions by Device topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for more information about supported devices.
Using the method with Advanced Sequence methods is unsupported.
member.param: specifies the name of the sequence to delete.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerOutputSourceOutput.Connected
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the output relay is connected (closed) or disconnected (open). The property does not change based on this property; they are independent of each other. Set this property to false to disconnect the output terminal from the output.
member.value: The default value is true.
member.remarks: Disconnect the output only if disconnecting is necessary for your application. For example, a battery connected to the output terminal might discharge unless the relay is disconnected. Excessive connecting and disconnecting of the output can cause premature wear on the relay. This property is not supported by all devices. Refer to the Supported Properties by Device topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for information about supported devices.

member.summary: Gets or sets the voltage level range, in volts, for the specified channel(s). The range defines the valid values to which the voltage level can be set. The channel must be enabled for the specified voltage level range to take effect. Refer to the property for more information about enabling the output channel.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerOutputSourceVoltage.VoltageLevelAutorange
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not NI-DCPower automatically selects the voltage level range based on the desired voltage level for the specified channels. If this property is set to , NI-DCPower ignores any changes you make to the property. If you change the property from to , NI-DCPower remembers the last value the property was set to (or the default value if the property was never set) and uses that value as the voltage level range. Query the property by getting the property value to find out which range NI-DCPower automatically selects. The property is applicable only if the property is set to .
member.value: Specifies an object of type .

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerPowerAllocationMode
member.summary: Determines whether the device sources the power its output configuration requires or a specific wattage you request; determines whether NI-DCPower proactively checks that this sourcing power is within the maximum per-channel and overall sourcing power of the device.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerPowerAllocationMode.Disabled
member.summary: The device attempts to source, on each active channel, the power that the present source configuration requires; NI-DCPower does not perform a sourcing power check. If the required power is greater than the maximum sourcing power, the device attempts to source the required amount and may shut down to prevent damage.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerPowerAllocationMode.Automatic
member.summary: The device attempts to source, on each active channel, the power that the present source configuration requires; NI-DCPower performs a sourcing power check. If the required power is greater than the maximum sourcing power, the device does not exceed the maximum power, and NI-DCPower returns an error.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerPowerAllocationMode.Manual
member.summary: The device attempts to source, on each active channel, the power you request with the property; NI-DCPower performs a sourcing power check. If the requested power is either less than the required power for the present source configuration or greater than the maximum sourcing power, the device does not exceed the requested or allowed power, respectively, and NI-DCPower returns an error.

member.summary: Gets or sets the output terminal for exporting the . Output terminals can be specified in one of two ways. If the device is named Dev1 and your terminal is PXI_Trig0, you can specify the terminal with the fully qualified terminal name, /Dev1/PXI_Trig0, or with the shortened terminal name, PXI_Trig0.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerPulseCompleteEvent.WaitForEvent(NationalInstruments.PrecisionTimeSpan)
member.summary: Waits until the device has generated the specified event. The session monitors whether each type of event has occurred at least once since the last time this method or the method was called. If an event has only been generated once, and you call this method successively, the method times out. Individual events must be generated between separate calls of this method.
member.param: Specifies the maximum time allowed for this function to complete, in seconds. If the function does not complete within this time interval, NI-DCPower returns an error.

remarks.note: This method must only be called in the Running state. Refer to the Programming States topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for information about the specific NI-DCPower software states.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerReadyForPulseTriggerEvent.WaitForEvent(NationalInstruments.PrecisionTimeSpan)
member.summary: Waits until the device has generated the specified event. The session monitors whether each type of event has occurred at least once since the last time this method or the method was called. If an event has only been generated once, and you call this method successively, the method times out. Individual events must be generated between separate calls of this method.
member.param: Specifies the maximum time allowed for this function to complete, in seconds. If the function does not complete within this time interval, NI-DCPower returns an error.

remarks.note: This method must only be called in the Running state. Refer to the Programming States topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for information about the specific NI-DCPower software states.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerSelfCalibration
member.summary: Defines methods and properties used to perform self calibration and query data related to self calibration.
member.remarks: For more information, refer to NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerSelfCalibration.SelfCalibrationPersistence
member.summary: Specifies whether the values calculated during self-calibration should be written to hardware to be used until the next self-calibration or only used until the method is called or the machine is powered down. This property affects the behavior of the method. If you set this property to , the values calculated by the method are used in the existing session, as well as in all further sessions until you call the method or restart the machine. When you set this property to , the values calculated by the method are written to hardware and used in the existing session and in all subsequent sessions until another call to the method is made.
member.value: The default value is .

remarks.note: This property is supported only on the NI PXIe-4140/4141, NI PXIe-4142/4143, and NI PXIe-4144/4145.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerSelfCalibration.SelfCalibrate(System.String)
member.summary: Self-calibrates the modules associated with the NI-DCPower, that support self-calibration.
member.param:
Specifies which output channels to apply this configuration value.
Specify multiple channels by using a channel list or a channel range. A channel list is a comma (,) separated sequence of channel names (for example, 0,2 specifies channels 0 and 2). A channel range is a lower bound channel followed by a hyphen (-) or colon (:) followed by an upper bound channel (for example, 0-2 specifies channels 0, 1, and 2). In the Running state, multiple output channel configurations are performed sequentially based on the order specified in this parameter. If there is only one channel in the session, you do not need to specify the channel name.
member.exception:
The method was accessed after the associated
object was disposed.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerSequenceIterationCompleteEvent.OutputTerminal
member.summary:
Gets or sets the output terminal for exporting the event. You can specify the output terminals in one of the following ways:
If the device is named Dev1 and your terminal is PXI_Trig0, you can specify the terminal with the fully qualified terminal name, /Dev1/PXI_Trig0, or with the shortened terminal name, PXI_Trig0.
member.value: Specifies an object of type .

remarks.note: The NI PXI-4110 and NI PXI-4130 do not support this property.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerSequenceIterationCompleteEvent.WaitForEvent(NationalInstruments.PrecisionTimeSpan)
member.summary: Waits until the device has generated the specified event. The session monitors whether each type of event has occurred at least once since the last time this method or the method was called. If an event has only been generated once, and you call this method successively, the method times out. Individual events must be generated between separate calls of this method.
member.param: Specifies the maximum time allowed for this method to complete, in seconds. If the method does not complete within this time interval, returns an error.

remarks.note: This method must only be called in the Running state. Refer to the Programming States topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for information about the specific NI-DCPower software states.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerSource.Mode
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to run a single output point or a sequence.
member.remarks: Refer to the Single Point Source Mode and Sequence Source Mode topics in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for more information about source modes.
member.value: The default value is .

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerSource.SequenceLoopCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of times a sequence is run after initiation.
member.value:
The default value is 1.
Valid values range from 1 to 134217727.
member.remarks:
Refer to the Sequence Source Mode topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for more information about the sequence loop count.
This property is not supported by all devices. Refer to the Supported Properties by Device topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for information about supported devices.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerSource.IsSequenceLoopCountFinite
member.summary: Gets or sets whether a sequence should repeat indefinitely.
member.value: The default value is true. If this property is set to false, this property is ignored.
member.remarks: Refer to the Sequence Source Mode topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for more information about the sequence loop count.This property is not supported by all devices. Refer to the Supported Properties by Device topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for information about supported devices.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether NI-DCPower allows setting the voltage level, current level, voltage limit and current limit outside the device specification limits.
member.value: if overranging is enabled; otherwise, . The default value is false.
member.remarks: Refer to the Ranges topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help topic in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help for more information about overranging.

member.summary: Defines a root class that is used to identify and control the instrument session.
member.remarks: All properties, methods, and events fall under either the class or are the sub-objects of this class. To interact with the NI-DCPower, you must create an instance of this class.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.NIDCPower.Close
member.summary: Closes the session to the device.
member.remarks:
The method can be called safely more than once, even if the session is already closed.
Calling close, disposes the SafeHandle used to hold the instrument handle. The ReleaseHandle method of the SafeHandle is overridden in our concrete implementation of SafeHandle, which calls into the Close of the Underlying driver. If a call to this Close fails for any reason, the most common being the session being closed by some external means, the user won't be notified of the failure. In order to help users identify failures in ReleaseHandle method, managed debugging assistant (MDA) is activated to notify developers when ReleaseHandle fails.
Common ways of externally closing a session:
1. Initializing a session with a resource name for which a session is already open, within the same process. Initializing a new session with the same resource name causes the instrument handle held by the existing session to become invalid.
2. User gets the instrument handle out using the method and closes this handle directly.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.NIDCPower.GetInstrumentHandle
member.summary: Gets the to the instrument session.
member.returns: The to the instrument session.
member.remarks: Using the , you can get the to the session; however, there are risks involved with using the . It is difficult to know the state of the handle, and the handle could be recycled while you are using it. For more information, refer to .
member.exception:

object was disposed.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.NIDCPower.Dispose
member.summary: Closes the specified session and deallocates the reserved resources, if not already disposed.
member.remarks:
You can call this method safely more than once, even if the session is already closed.
A call to this method disposes the SafeHandle class used to hold the instrument handle. If the call to this method fails due to some reason, like the session being closed by some external means, you will not be notified about the failure. To help you identify failures in the ReleaseHandle method of the SafeHandle class, managed debugging assistant (MDA) is activated.
For details refer to .
The call to this method fails when you externally close a session by:
Initializing a session with a resource name for which the session is already open, within the same process. This causes the instrument handle held by the existing session to become invalid.
Getting the instrument handle out using the method and closing this handle directly.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.NIDCPower.ExportSignal(NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIDCPower.DCPowerSignalSource,System.String)
member.summary: Routes trigger and event signals to the output terminal you specify. The route is created when the session is committed.

remarks.note: This method is not supported on all devices. For information about supported devices, refer to Supported Properties by Device in the NI DC Power Supplies and SMUs Help.

member.param: The trigger or event signal to export.

The terminal to route the signal to. For example, if the device is named "Dev1" and your terminal is "PXI_Trig0", you can specify the terminal with the fully qualified terminal name, "/Dev1/PXI_Trig0", or with the shortened terminal name, "PXI_Trig0".
member.exception: was called on a session to unsupported hardware.

was called after the associated
object was disposed.

The value of is invalid.
- or - The destination terminal to be routed cannot be found on the device.
- or - The underlying NI-DCPower driver returned an error.
